camel.kamelet.google-mail-source.index.name: camel.kamelet.google-mail-source.index
camel.kamelet.google-mail-source.index.description: An index for the google mail endpoint

camel.kamelet.google-mail-source.clientI.name: camel.kamelet.google-mail-source.clientId
camel.kamelet.google-mail-source.clientI.description: Client ID of the gmail application

camel.kamelet.google-mail-source.clientS.name: camel.kamelet.google-mail-source.clientSecret
camel.kamelet.google-mail-source.clientS.description: Client Secret of the gmail application

camel.kamelet.google-mail-source.accessT.name: camel.kamelet.google-mail-source.accessToken
camel.kamelet.google-mail-source.accessT.description: OAuth 2 access token for google mail application. This typically expires after an hour so refreshToken is recommended for long term usage.

camel.kamelet.google-mail-source.refresh.name: camel.kamelet.google-mail-source.refreshToken
camel.kamelet.google-mail-source.refresh.description: OAuth 2 refresh token for google mail application. Using this, the Google Calendar component can obtain a new accessToken whenever the current one expires - a necessity if the application is long-lived.

camel.kamelet.google-mail-source.markAsR.name: camel.kamelet.google-mail-source.markAsRead
camel.kamelet.google-mail-source.markAsR.description: Mark the message as read once it has been consumed

camel.kamelet.google-mail-source.labels.name: camel.kamelet.google-mail-source.labels
camel.kamelet.google-mail-source.labels.description: Comma separated list of labels to take into account Example: inbox

camel.kamelet.google-mail-source.query.name: camel.kamelet.google-mail-source.query
camel.kamelet.google-mail-source.query.description: The query to execute on gmail box Example: is:unread -category:(promotions OR social)
